title: Apfelkuchen (Apple Cake)
description: This traditional German Apfelkuchen is a delightful apple cake that combines a soft, buttery yeast dough with tender, spiced apples and a crumbly topping. Perfect for Easter brunch or any cozy gathering, its warm cinnamon and nutmeg flavors evoke comforting memories and invite you to savor every bite.
ingredients: 3 large apples - peeled, cored, and sliced
instructions: Grease the bottom and sides of a 9x13-inch baking dish or a 9-inch springform pan.

In a large bowl, beat 2 ¼ cups flour, warm milk, ¼ cup sugar, active dry yeast, 6 tablespoons softened butter, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt with an electric mixer on high speed until the dough is smooth, about 5 minutes.
Spread the dough evenly into the prepared baking dish, pressing it up the sides.
Press the peeled, cored, and sliced apples evenly into the dough.
In a separate bowl, mix 1 cup sugar, ¾ cup flour, chopped candied lemon peel (if using), ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and a pinch of salt.
Cut in ½ cup butter with a knife or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Sprinkle this crumb topping evenly over the apples.
Allow the dough to rise in a warm place for 30 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Bake the cake in the preheated oven until golden brown and the apples are tender, about 35 minutes.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.
tips: For the best texture, make sure your milk is warm but not hot to activate the yeast properly. Press the apples gently into the dough so they stay in place during baking. Avoid overbaking to keep the cake moist and tender.

structured_content.content: Apfelkuchen is a beloved German apple cake that combines a soft, yeasted dough with juicy, spiced apples and a buttery crumb topping. Its warm aroma and tender texture make it a standout dish perfect for Easter brunch or any special occasion.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour 30 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for Easter brunch, family gatherings, or cozy weekend treats
  • Uses simple pantry staples and fresh apples
  • A wonderful balance of soft dough, tender fruit, and crumbly topping

structured_content.content: I first tasted Apfelkuchen in sixth grade when our teacher brought treats from a local German bakery. The sweet spices and buttery crumb instantly captured my heart, and baking it myself now brings back those cherished memories every time.

• Main ingredient: Fresh, crisp apples work best for a balance of tartness and sweetness; peel, core, and slice evenly for uniform baking.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Ground cinnamon and nutmeg add warm, comforting spice; candied lemon peel adds a subtle citrus brightness if desired.
  • Supporting ingredients: Yeast dough provides a soft, tender base while the crumb topping adds a delightful crunch and buttery richness.
  • Equipment needed: Electric mixer for smooth dough, 9x13-inch baking dish or springform pan, knife or pastry blender for crumb topping.

Preparation:
Mix and beat the dough ingredients until smooth, about 5 minutes, then spread into the greased pan and press apples into the dough. Prepare crumb topping by cutting butter into dry ingredients until coarse crumbs form.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Sprinkle crumb topping over apples, let dough rise for 30 minutes, then bake at 400°F (200°C) for about 35 minutes until golden and apples are tender.
Finishing Touches:
Allow to cool slightly before slicing to let flavors meld and the cake set for perfect slices.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use warm milk (not hot) to activate yeast without killing it
  • Don’t skip the rising time to ensure a light, fluffy dough
  • Look for a golden-brown crust and tender apples as signs of doneness
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate; reheat gently before serving

structured_content.content: Sharing this Apfelkuchen with family always brings smiles and nostalgia. It’s a dish that connects generations, evoking warmth and the joy of homemade comfort food.

Enhance the cake by adding a splash of rum or brandy to the crumb topping, or sprinkle sliced almonds on top before baking for extra crunch. Fresh lemon zest can brighten the apple filling, and a dusting of powdered sugar after baking adds a pretty finishing touch.

Serve warm with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for a decadent treat. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or spiced tea for a perfect brunch experience. This cake also complements fresh fruit salads or light green salads for balanced meals.

For a gluten-free version, substitute the flour with a gluten-free baking mix suitable for yeast doughs. Vegan adaptations can be made by using plant-based milk and butter alternatives, and replacing the egg with flaxseed meal if desired. Add pears or berries for a fruity twist while keeping the classic feel.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Beat the dough thoroughly to develop gluten for a tender yet sturdy base
  • Cut butter into crumb topping until coarse crumbs form for perfect texture
  • Let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free spot for best results
  • Press apples gently but firmly into dough to keep them from sliding during baking

structured_content.content: With this Apfelkuchen recipe, you’re not just baking a cake—you’re creating a warm, inviting experience that fills your home with irresistible aromas and brings loved ones together. Enjoy the process and savor every delicious bite!
